sanskrit_verse:
शूद्रैव भार्या शूद्रस्य सा च स्वा च विशः स्मृते ।
ते च स्वा चैव राज्ञश्च ताश्च स्वा चाग्रजन्मनः ॥ ३.१३॥
transliteration:
śūdraiva bhāryā śūdrasya sā ca svā ca viśaḥ smṛte |
te ca svā caiva rājñaśca tāśca svā cāgrajanmanaḥ || 3.13||
sph_interpretive_translation: Only a Śūdra woman is the lawful wife of a Śūdra; among the Vaiśyas, both sisters and daughters-in-law are considered wives. Among Kṣatriyas, wives include sisters, daughters-in-law, and queens. Among Brāhmaṇas, all these categories—including those born of elder brothers—are recognized as lawful wives.
